title: Broch of Gurness Walking Route

images.title: Mark Crook / Broch of Gurness
images.caption: Broch of Gurness. Looking northwest towards Rousay.

images.title: Lis Burke / Broch of Gurness
images.caption: Showing the thickness of the main broch wall.

images.title: Colin Smith / Pictish Village, Broch of Gurness
images.caption: Pictish Village, Broch of Gurness Drystane walls, cupboards, walls, etc abut the neolithic broch which was inhabited by both Picts and Vikings. The stone huts coalesce into an amorphous mass around the broch.

description: Visit this Iron Age broch village on Mainland Orkney and learn about its fascinating history stretching back over 2000 years. There are also wonderful coastal views over the Eynhallow Sound to enjoy from this photogenic spot. You can start the walk from the public car park at the Point at Hellia.
